runs.comm: starts off with a wide, short ball angled too far across him
short ball again, closer to his body this time, and he shoulders arms
shimmies down the pitch and shoulders arms to a short ball outside off
fuller, not driveable yet, McCullum gets an inside edge onto the pad
full toss outside off, gets a single off a thick outside edge
wide down the leg side, too much of angle there
Jissyyyyy! short ball, he has loads of time to pull it square over the infield, two bounces into the fence
pitched up and McCullum goes after it right away, gets a thick edge but he has enough on it to clear the infield square on the off side
McCullum jumps down the track and is beaten by a sharp outswinger. Doesn't miss the off stump by much
short and wide, doesn't quite come on, but McCullum makes good adjustment, cutting it in front of square, between mid-off and extra cover
oh oh oh.... McCullum gives him the charge, backs a way a bit, Sami looks to follow him and bowls a huge huge leg-side wide
good come back, back of a length, no room, McCullum can't do much more than defend it back to him
misses out, this one is angled down the leg side, he fails to connect and gets a leg-bye
goes for the yorker outside off, and ends up bowling the second wide of the over
short, on the stumps, Ryder looks to make room and cut, makes good connection, but can't beat point
good slower ball, 120.7ks, beats him on the pull - he is looking for that shot from outside off
fuller, quicker, 138.2ks, hit slightly wide of mid-off for one
full, on the pads, misses out really, with the fine leg up. The ball deflects off the pad towards point
stops at him a touch as he looks to hit it over the on side, but the mis-hit manages to clear mid-on
walks down the pitch, turns this into a half-volley and works it to square leg for one
this time Ryder utilises a leg-side delivery, helping it past mid-on - not much power behind it - for two
comes down the track and backs away, Sami follows him, cramping him up, but he still manages to hit it straight enough to mid-on and hard enough to go for four
shot, lovely shot, short ball, doesn't quite come on, waits a bit for it, and cuts it to left of backward point and right of third man
pulls, doesn't get all behind it, gets a single to square leg
flashes at it outside off without much feet movement and is beaten

he has picked out deep square leg! Looked like a good shot, a flick-chip to a length ball, but he sort of forgot the fielder placed there. Not a mis-hit, it went where he wanted it, but a miscalculation there
full, outside off, hit straight to mid-off - too hard to think of a single
starts off with a wide, arm ball fired down the leg side
flighted around leg stump, full ball, defended
another full ball, flat, no spin, defended off the front foot
flat again, angled into the pads, bunts it for one
flighted around leg stump, defended back to him
flatter, shorter, defended again
short, into the pads, McCullum gets on a knee and pulls it past short fine
beats him with a straight delivery outside off
close to off stump, accurate, defended, not much spin
makes room, Hafeez follows him, hit uppishly towards midwicket
slows this one down, and gets sharp turn to beat him
straighter one again and beats him outside off again
hits to midwicket, runs, the single is not on but the fielder misses the direct hit

and the frustration shows and gets Pakistan a wicket! Comes down the track, is not quite to the pitch of it, and mis-hits it towards long-on where Umar Akmal takes a superb diving-forward catch. he tries for the two-handed catch, can't reach it, but gets the right hand under it. Top stuff
lapped away to fine leg for one
starts off with a bunt to midwicket for one
flat delivery, pushed to long-on for one
gets across the line, and helps it into the on side from outside off
moves across and works it for one to square leg
flat ball, into the pads, defended to mid-on
pauses in the delivery stride, no spin still, McCullum works it past short fine
shuffles across, works this from off-stump line to deep square leg
full ball, played to midwicket, straight to the fielder
pushed down to long-on for one
plays into the off side for a change, hitting it straight to cover
rare loose ball, long hop, and pulled away past midwicket who gets a hand to it and hence just two runs
breaks the shackles, sweeps it from outside off, in the air, and superb placement to make sure it is in front of deep square leg
extra bounce! McCullum sweeps again, this time goes square, and the bounce takes the top edge that settles down the lap of deep square leg. Spinners exercising a choke hold here
full ball, pushed down to long-on for one
fired down the leg side
optimistic appeal for lbw, there is a big inside edge onto the pad, and it's outside off anyway
flat and fast, defended back to the bowler
works this from off and outside to square leg for one

don't let Afridi touch you today, you might turn to gold! After a horrible opening spell, Sami comes back and strikes second ball. It's back of a length, gives him width, Taylor goes hard at it, and is not close to it, and gets a fine outside edge
goes right back, opens the face, gets it past point for one
short, angling away, cut to deep point for one
back of a length, into the pads, helped away for a one
short, hurries him up, goes for the pull, and ends up pulling it to mid-on
flat outside off, no spin, played to straightish extra cover
quicker, straighter, one, angling in, Afridi appeals, reckons it's pad first, umpire doesn't think so. Replays go with Afridi
swept away to fine leg for one
flighted outside off, driven towards sweeper-cover for one
lovely googly, gets Vettori's edge but he is saved as it hits his own pad on the way and deflects towards short third man
pushed to wide of long-on, and they run well to come back for two
top shot, opens up his body and sweeps this in front of square, all along the ground, smack between deep square and deep midwicket
goes with the angle, beats him, and hits him in the pad
shorter, slower, looks for the sweep, gets a bottom edge for one
full ball, pushed down to long-on
premeditates a sweep, and he bowls this extremely slowly, and Vettori has to wait and wait and manages a bottom edge towards short fine
full, into the pads, worked away, but straight to midwicket
top edge on the sweep, but this lands in front of deep square
full outside off, driven to sweeper-cover
flighted, extremely slow, wide down the leg side
quicker ball, angled across him, beats him outside off
Dan the man, what a shot! Chips down the track and just flicks it way over long-off. Lovely timing. His first T20 international six
seam-up delivery, quick it is, and he pulls it into the on side
full, into the pads, worked away for one
shortish outside off, late-cut, but finds short third man
sharp offbreak, worked away to short fine leg
superb running, Vettori opens the face and runs it down to short third, and Styris dives full length to make that single possible
toppie, and they steal another single, soft hands, dab to short third, and they hare through
another topspinner, hurries him, played back to the bowler
shortish, and he looks to pull, and gets a bottom edge onto the pads, hurries him into the shot again
Scottieeee! out of nowhere he opens up, just lofts this length delivery over long-off, clean and simple shot
sweeps, sweeps in front of square, along the ground, into the gap past midwicket, New Zealand are hanging in
quick, too quick, hits him in the pad

played on! Pakistan pull NZ back again. It's Afridi's pace again. No niceties such as flight and spin. Just fired it in around off, Styris looks to run it down, and gets the bottom edge onto the stumps
quick, around off, defended
straighter, and pushed to long-on this time
dabbed down to short third for one
Vettori tries his pull over fine leg, walks all the way across, leaving the stumps exposed, gets the pulling length but is beaten by the extra bounce
swept in front of square, wide enough of long-on to come back for two
moves all the way across again, looks for the sweep, misses, is hit outside the line of off
gets a top edge on the sweep this time, but it lands short of deep midwicket
shapes to pull, looking for the break back towards him, the ball goes straight through and he ends up hitting it to cover
fast, bowled like a seamer, 106.9ks, pulled from outside leg to deep square for one
pitched up outside off, goes for the big drive and is beaten
pace and fire maan! 125.7ks, seam-up and just plain fast, can't do much with it, he is just too stunned
lovely bowling, flights this one up, speed in the late 80s, Hopkins sees this is the only ball he can hit, and slog-sweeps, gets a top edge and holes out to deep midwicket
quick offcutter, beats him outside off
flighted around the leg stump, worked away for one
looks for big sweep, is beaten by the offbreak that misses the off stump by inches
tossed up wide, he has backed away too early, and mis-hits it towards long-off
moves across to off stump, and helps it to short third
chips down the track, Ajmal fires it in, gets an inside edge onto the pad
length ball, Vettori stays back this time and he slog-sweeps it over long-on. They need three-four more of these
swept from way outside off, wide of deep midwicket, but Vettori loses balance while sweeping and gets only a single

lovely slower bouncer, gets the top edge from Vettori but it lands around the 30-yard circle around the fine-leg area, and Ajmal is not really urgent in running towards it, letting them come back for two
lovely bouncer, quicker one this time, beats him on the pull, but it is the second bouncer of the over and hence a no-ball. Remember, no free-hit for this one
short ball, backs away and pulls, and gets a single to midwicket
Nathan tries a Brendon-like shot, walking down the track and swinging, and misses by a long way
slower bouncer, doesn't get shoulder high, hence he is okay, and McCullum manages to pull it towards deep midwicket and they come back for two
big shout and not given! Walks down the track and swings again. There is a sound of a nick as the ball passes the bat and also a deviation. But Billy Doctrove thinks otherwise
length ball outside off, driven wide of long-off, they come back for two
clever batting, shows him that he is backing away, makes him fire it down the leg side, and then moves inside the line
another straight slog-sweep, and straight enough for them to hustle back for two
Ajmal takes the lead in the cat-and-mouse, sees him charging down, bowls short and wide, and concedes just a single off the bottom edge
topspinner outside off, and Nathan McCullum ends up swinging inside the line of it
another toppie, this one bounces too, and he is beaten while looking to slog it over midwicket
hit to long-off, and Vettori sacrifices his wicket going for a non-existent second
finally McCullum makes connection, sits back and waits for this topspinner that is a touch short and pulls it over deep midwicket
